verses.text: 亞伯蘭帶著妻子和所有的一切，以及羅得，一同從埃及上到南地去。

words.note: Refers to the southern region of Canaan.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭有很多牲畜和金銀。

words.note: Often used in religious or agricultural contexts.

verses.text: 他從南地一站一站往前走，到伯特利去；到伯特利和艾城中間，就是他起先支搭帳棚的地方，

words.note: Refers to the southern region of Canaan.

words.definition: station by station, bit by bit
words.note: Indicates progression in stages or steps.
艾 (Ài) is the transliterated sound, 城 (chéng) means 'city'.
Specifically for setting up tents or temporary structures.
More common in historical or biblical contexts than modern daily use.

verses.text: 也是他築頭一座祭壇的地方，亞伯蘭就在那裡求告耶和華的名。

words.note: Used with '座' as a measure word for buildings or mountains.
A platform or table for religious sacrifice.
Specifically refers to calling on God or a deity.
The Hebrew name for God, often rendered LORD in English Bibles.

verses.text: 和亞伯蘭同行的羅得，也有羊群、牛群和帳棚。

words.note: A collective noun for sheep.
A collective noun for cattle.
More common in historical or biblical contexts than modern daily use.

verses.text: 那地容不下他們住在一起；因為他們的財物很多，所以他們再也不能住在一起。

words.note: Refers to movable property or wealth.
Always used with 不 or 沒 to mean 'no longer'.

verses.text: 牧養亞伯蘭牲畜的和牧養羅得牲畜的，起了紛爭；當時迦南人和比利洗人還住在那地。

words.note: To tend and feed livestock.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭就對羅得說：「你我之間，切不可紛爭；你的牧人和我的牧人之間，也不可紛爭，因為我們是至親。

words.note: Refers to blood relatives or close family.

verses.text: 全地不都是在你面前嗎？請你離開我吧！你若向左，我就向右；你若向右，我就向左。」

words.note: A partial negation, meaning 'not all of them' rather than 'none of them'.
More formal or literary than 如果 (rúguǒ).

verses.text: 羅得舉目，看見約旦河整個平原，直到瑣珥，都有水灌溉；在耶和華毀滅所多瑪和蛾摩拉之前，這地好像耶和華的園子，也像埃及地一樣。

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH.
Refers to the country or region of Egypt.

verses.text: 羅得選擇了約旦河整個平原，於是向東移動，他們就彼此分開了。
亞伯蘭住在迦南地；羅得住在平原的城市中，漸漸挪移帳棚，直到所多瑪。
在耶和華看來，所多瑪人是罪大惡極的。

words.note: Often used in the structure '在...看來' (in X's opinion).
A four-character idiom describing extreme evil.

verses.text: 羅得離開亞伯蘭以後，耶和華對亞伯蘭說：「你要舉目，從你所在的地方向東南西北觀看。

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts.
An idiom referring to all four cardinal directions.

verses.text: 你看見的地方，我都要賜給你和你的後裔，直到永遠。

words.note: More formal and respectful than '給'.

verses.text: 我要使你的後裔好像地上灰塵那麼多；若能數算地上的灰塵，才能數算你的後裔。

words.note: A common biblical term for 'posterity'.
More formal than 如果 (rúguǒ).
Often used in biblical contexts when talking about counting large quantities.
Often used in biblical contexts when talking about counting large quantities.
A common biblical term for 'posterity'.

verses.text: 你起來，縱橫走遍這地，因為我必把這地賜給你。」

words.note: Implies moving extensively in all directions.
Stronger than 會 (huì) or 要 (yào).
A formal term for giving, often from a superior.

verses.text: 於是，亞伯蘭漸漸挪移帳棚，來到希伯崙幔利的橡樹附近，在那裡居住，也在那裡為耶和華築了一座祭壇。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes the gradual nature.
Often refers to moving something from its original position.
A common word for 'tent' in biblical narratives.
The Hebrew proper name for God.
Often used for building structures like walls or altars.
